raw_response:
**Hita**, a Tunisian Jewish Djerban dish traditionally part of the Shabbat stew (Hamin/Adafina), has a distinctive visual and textural presentation when served.

- **Visual appearance and consistency:** Hita appears as a thick, richly colored stew with a deep brown to almost black hue, primarily due to the deeply caramelized onions and slow-cooked ingredients. Unlike a clear broth or a light soup, it has a dense, smooth, and somewhat paste-like texture similar to other Tunisian Jewish slow-cooke
